channel.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
channel.description:
[b]I do not believe i put up with this bullshit for over a month, when the solution was that i just needed to clean out the inside of it... wow i'm just a fucking moron... a moron who also could fuck up a ubuntu installation more than 5 times, yeah... five times.
This can be locked.[/b]
Re-formatting is not an option. My computer gets the blue screen of death like every ten minutes, and says it is doing a virtual memory dump. It has been doing this for at least a month. Before it shuts off, usually 2/3 programs just shutdown, without warning. I have done 2 different kinds of diagnostic checks, they all came back fine. I have updated my computer. I send in error reports, and i either get a corrupted error report or an error report that says that there is a device driver error. I really need help, because I'm assfucked. I've done virus scans and everything, no virus. The only explanation for this happening is that I've been torrenting music, but I used an external disk to do it, all the music was on that disk. I seriously need help... or else I'm going to have to spend like 50$ getting a diagnostic test from Staples or something.

item.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“thefalloffuckingtroy., post:20, topic:253731”][quote author=Holic link=topic=335196.msg2613850#msg2613850 date=1230913481]
bsod is the infamous blue screen of death.
[/quote]

of i know what you mean now, it just gives me different numbers like “0x9870467” or something like that and then sometimes it gives a file name thats either .dll or .sys[/quote]

Write the number down and the filename it gives you, and google it or search the Microsoft KB (http://support.microsoft.com).

Read full topic
item.source: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)

item.source: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)

item.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

[quote=“thefalloffuckingtroy., post:17, topic:253731”][quote author=Javacisnotrecognized link=topic=335196.msg2611744#msg2611744 date=1230787797]

Do a System Restore to a point before the BSOD’s happened.

I tried, it didn’t work. My computer won’t even load into Safe mode, it just loads all these .sys files and thats it… idk i’m going to install linux as a dual boot, that should tell me if its a problem with the OS or just the computer itself right?

What’s the last file it loads before it freezes? Probably the driver to a messed up device, or a corrupt system file.
[/quote]

Anything, things will just randomly shut down like firefox and aim. Like firefox will just shutdown and give a crash report and if i try to open it again it goes straight to the crash report and heaven forbid it actually loads it’ll crash after the pages load.

Why is reformatting not an option? And can you read the BSOD, or does it flash on the screen and immediately shut down?

Because my itunes library is very important to me, and i lost my photoshop keygen :o

and dood i don’t even know what a bsod is, but i know its the video card or some shit now because installed linux last night (unsuccessfully apparently because when i start up in Ubuntu it just goes to a linux version of the command prompt, and that’s it) but while it was loading the screen got all fucked up just like it does in windows, so i’ll take apart my computer later and dust the shit off and if it’s still broken i’ll get a new vcard i guess.[/quote]
re download…?
I’ve re-formated 3 times…

Read full topic

item.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
item.dc:creator: @thefalloffuckingtroy thefalloffuckingtroy.
item.description:
@thefalloffuckingtroy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:15, topic:253731”][quote author=thefalloffuckingtroy. link=topic=335196.msg2611733#msg2611733 date=1230786906]

Do a System Restore to a point before the BSOD’s happened.

I tried, it didn’t work. My computer won’t even load into Safe mode, it just loads all these .sys files and thats it… idk i’m going to install linux as a dual boot, that should tell me if its a problem with the OS or just the computer itself right?
[/quote]

What’s the last file it loads before it freezes? Probably the driver to a messed up device, or a corrupt system file.[/quote]

Anything, things will just randomly shut down like firefox and aim. Like firefox will just shutdown and give a crash report and if i try to open it again it goes straight to the crash report and heaven forbid it actually loads it’ll crash after the pages load.

Zach1188:

Why is reformatting not an option? And can you read the BSOD, or does it flash on the screen and immediately shut down?

Because my itunes library is very important to me, and i lost my photoshop keygen :o

and dood i don’t even know what a bsod is, but i know its the video card or some shit now because installed linux last night (unsuccessfully apparently because when i start up in Ubuntu it just goes to a linux version of the command prompt, and that’s it) but while it was loading the screen got all fucked up just like it does in windows, so i’ll take apart my computer later and dust the shit off and if it’s still broken i’ll get a new vcard i guess.

Read full topic

thanks

item.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

http://www.memtest86.com/

Possibly bad registers? I had this problem in a shit computer from Best Buy. After that incident, I build my own from a whole sale distributor.

Please enable the computer to hang on BSoD’s rather than reboot and copy the error here. It will help a lot for diagnostic purposes.

Read full topic

item.title: I don't know what to do anymore. (lock this)
item.dc:creator: @thefalloffuckingtroy thefalloffuckingtroy.
item.description:
@thefalloffuckingtroy wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:4, topic:253731”]Well it’s obviously one or more of your hardware devices that is causing it to blue screen. Hopefully unlike my problem it’s something you can replace without having to get a whole new machine.

Try to run your own diagnostic test by taking out one piece of hardware and then seeing if the bsod still happens.[/quote]

i think its the video card.

Read full topic
